text:
Hi :wave:
The question. How to upload module or theme using CMS Templates API? Because there is a problem with simply sending through post request json files.
HubSpot server responds the with message: ‘Only css, js, and html files are supported.’
<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U504BHZ6K> Could you please chime into this problem?
We are developing browser push messaging solution for HubSpot. Customer wouldn’t be happy installing CMS module manually

Hello!

I’m trying to create an app to make a request to force sync data between HubSpot and our system (in cases our Operations team suspects that the record is not properly sync). In HS Developer Account I didn’t find any way to create buttons in the CRM cards to call an endpoint.

Anyone knows how to do that? Example from another app below.

there’s a parameter to include in the API request to list only archived records <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

i don’t think the endpoints sort for you, but you can see in the response schema that you can use archivedAt to sort by

Thanks for replying back, Stephen.

But how to SORT them? Because the result is totally random, maybe based on the ID.

I just need to detect which objects were deleted after a period.
Hey Roman, the CMS Templates API wouldnt be the API you would want for this. I’ll DM you with more info on this.
Hey, have there been any changes to the Pages API? We noticed this morning that our app (63170) is getting an error when creating a page.

```{"correlationId":"51e59513-9b4d-4aff-98c7-06e545f41e5d","errorType":"TRUST_VIOLATION","message":"This portal has been flagged as a violation of the acceptable use policy and cannot create content.","status":"error"}```
getting the same error on multiple (all) portals
Hey Cristian, is this a newer portal that was created that is having this error?
Hey <@U2H3TT8F2> not really.. some of these portals are super old
hrmmm… let me see what i can find out
Can you DM your portal IDs that are getting this error
on it
Check out “Actions”. I think those are probably what you want, maybe ACTION_HOOKS specifically <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#action-types>

Hey, kinda new to the Api & I got a small question:

For the life of me I cannot seem to find where in the documentation the list is for the acceptable HubSpot defined variables (like "toObjectType" and "associationType")

Could someone please point me in the right direction.

Thanks in advance.

Hello!!
Quick question: How to check if the contact is a _*merged contact*_ ?
Is it posible to define ONE_TO_ONE relationships with custom objects? I've been playing around with cardinality but doesn't seem to make a difference.
Is there any way to file a bug report?
Hey Adrian, we dont have any way officially via the slack but I would reach out to in-app support and let them know.
I can't remember where I saw it before. Possibly in another community thread. The object and association types are the plural forms of the objects i.e. companies, deals, etc.
our company uses single-sign on with google. is there a way for me to use that with HubSpot api?

Hey <@UNU1C7MA7> not at this time. We do have plans to offer the ability to customize the cardinality but it’s not ready yet. There are a bunch of downstream effects in tools like Lists and Workflows that need to be worked on first.
Hey <@U01DEU5EQM9> in the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_contact|v1 API> there is a property in the response called `merged-vids` you can use

<@U01TL8J5YDA> To get the association types, you can use the List Association Types endpoint from the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations|Associations API>.  The object names are either the common ones that <@U01DG96K18T> mentioned or you can get them from the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects|Schemas API >(object definition tab) if it’s a custom object.
Hey <@U01L4SDDW2H> there is no way to sort the results. You can page through them and use the `archivedAt` field to see when they were deleted

I’m not exactly sure what you mean but the only methods of authentication available for the HubSpot API are API key and OAuth 2.0. Happy to hear more details about how you might use SSO with our API and pass that along to the relevant product manager on our side.

Thanks Zack, but this approach doesn't work for me, since we are a SaaS platform with hundreds HubSpot customers.
It would become a problem for me and HubSpot if I always go over all pages to pull the recent deleted objects. A simple sort feature would solve this issue.
In that case you may want to check our the object delete webhooks to stay up to date on when an object is deleted
But I'll pass your feedback along regardless

Thanks, this is what we are doing today, but we are having several out-of-sync situations, intermittent behavior when handling webhooks events.

The solution, for now, is to rebuild our mirror cache from time to time
I appreciate your comments and follow-up
Gotcha, no problem
One thing to note on your cache rebuild, make sure it's run more than every 90 days, the recycling bin empties itself after that
Oh, I got it! Thanks for warning me about that
is it possbile to show current logged in user data to a HubSpot web page
like in facebook when you are logged your icon will show up on top right of the page.
